Package ohos.multimodalinput.event

Provides classes that define input events, such as key and manipulation events.

Related classes are as follows:

  • MultimodalEvent: Represents the base class of all event types. This class defines a series of high-level event types that represent abstracted user behaviors or intents. In addition, it defines the methods and information shared by various child classes.
  • KeyEvent: Defines the keycodes and methods for various key events. This class extends the MultimodalEvent class.
  • ManipulationEvent: Reports manipulation events that represent abstracted actions, such as finger touch events and stylus events. Such an event contains information such as the location and phase of the event.
  • EventCreator: Provides methods for creating events, Currently, only the method of creating the KeyEvent event is provided.
Since:
3
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BuiltinKeyEvent
    Defines the key events of internal input devices.
    CompositeEvent
    Defines composite events specific to common devices.
    EventCreator
    Provides methods for creating events.
    KeyBoardEvent
    Defines all keyboard events.
    KeyEvent
    Defines all key events.
    ManipulationEvent
    Reports manipulation events.
    MmiPoint
    Represents the x, y, or z coordinate in a given coordinate system.
    MouseEvent
    Reports mouse events.
    MultimodalEvent
    Represents the base class of all event types.
    RotationEvent
    Defines events generated by rotation components, for example, a digital watch crown on a smart watch.
    SpeechEvent
    Defines speech events.
    StylusEvent
    Reports stylus events.
    TouchEvent
    Defines touch events and mapped standard events.
